title: GDP deflator decreases, inflation is negative

content.prompt: Using 2010 as the base year, the gross domestic product (GDP) deflator in 2011 was 97. Which of the following must be true?

choices.label: The inflation rate in 2011 was positive.
The inflation rate in 2011 was negative.
The inflation rate in 2011 was zero.
The purchasing power of a dollar decreased by 3 percent.
The real output increased by 3 percent.

unit.text: 2: Economic Indicators and the Business Cycle

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
